text.div:
BC EvaluationComponent Logical Model

A simplified, non-separable evaluation consisting of a finding code (represented by the Concept), value (or exception value), reference range, and interpretation. The subject of the evaluation component is the same as in the parent evaluation.

name: EvaluationComponentModel
title: BC EvaluationComponent Logical Model
publisher: The HL7 Cancer Interoperability Group sponsored by Clinical Interoperability Council Work Group (CIC)
description:
A simplified, non-separable evaluation consisting of a finding code (represented by the Concept), value (or exception value), reference range, and interpretation.

The subject of the evaluation component is the same as in the parent evaluation.

element.definition:
A simplified, non-separable evaluation consisting of a finding code (represented by the Concept), value (or exception value), reference range, and interpretation.

The subject of the evaluation component is the same as in the parent evaluation.

element.short: Choice of types representing a simplified, non-separable evaluation consisting of a finding code (represented by the Concept), value (or exception value), reference range, and interpretation.
element.definition:
Choice of types representing a simplified, non-separable evaluation consisting of a finding code (represented by the Concept), value (or exception value), reference range, and interpretation.

The subject of the evaluation component is the same as in the parent evaluation.

element.short: Reason that a value associated with a test or other finding is missing.
element.definition:
Reason that a value associated with a test or other finding is missing.

CIMI Alignment: This attribute corresponds to EvaluationResultTopic.exceptionValue, but has been moved from topic to context because missing values are only relevant when they should be recorded, but are not. The value set binding extends the set of FHIR's required data absent values, with additional concepts from CIMI.

element.short: A clinical interpretation of a finding.
element.definition:
A clinical interpretation of a finding.

CIMI Alignment: The value set binding has been chosen to align with FHIR. (Note: it is not clear if Interpretation belongs in FindingTopic, rather than a context class, but that is how CIMI has modeled it.)

element.short: The usual or acceptable range for a test result.
element.definition: The usual or acceptable range for a test result.

The subject of the evaluation component is the same as in the parent evaluation.

element.definition: The usual or acceptable range for a test result.
